title: What is your opinion about Red Velvet (South Korea girl group)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Red Velvet is an amazing group. I don't really care if you agree cause it is simply my taste and opinion. Actually there are a few opinions about the group and I would gladly want to gain explanations from fellow reveluvs on this. 1. Irene, Yeri and Joy have a weird tension. Hear me out on this, Idk whether they always have interacted like this but recently I have been noticing them getting very weird or awkward around each other, by recently I mean since the past year. Idk why but it feels like one of them did something to the other and they are on bad terms in some way 2. Irene is close to Seulgi and Wendy It is kind of obvious, I have never seen Irene get touchy like with hugs and stuff with Yeri or Joy, she tends to lean/hug Seulgi and Wendy a lot, again it could just be because of the age gap but referring to my first point, I feel there's some tension among Irene, Yeri and Joy. 3. Seulgi isn't a very out and about kind of person She seems quite silent on reality shows and stuff, she seems to be very interactive only when she is really interested in whatever is happening or which has one on one interaction. Like on Hello82, when Irene and Seulgi were meeting a fan as a surprise, Seulgi was super interactive and talkative and kept the fan engaged compared to her silent demeanour on variety shows 4. Irene is super clever and mature, which people don’t notice or see Irene is super competitive which makes her quite attractive in my opinion plus her way of talking makes me think that she is mentally much older than she is physically and she seems to get a hint on how to act and interact with others pretty easily. 5. Yeri is just an extra member in RV for SM ent. Honestly the way Yeri is treated by SM makes me think that she is not really taken as seriously as she is supposed to be, like to elaborate, she is hardly given lines, she is never the center in any of the choreographies, which really makes me think that they just added Yeri to RV because they didn't know what to do with her until the next GG debut(which hasn’t happened yet plus even if it were too, she would be much older). 6.RV is a group of random girls, completely unplanned Seulgi trained under SM for 7 years because there was no GG to debut in, Irene was selected for her Visual initially and tbh despite training, her talent doesn't even come out much because of her rapper position in a non rap focused group. Wendy looks like someone who would have been a soloist under the label and Joy just felt like she shouldn’t have debuted at that time- she was a baby. As per again my previous point, Yeri too feels pretty off as per how she was added a year later. To me RV seems like a random shuffle game of the girls being put together and surprisingly they just worked out well. SM should be grateful. 7. Don't feel annoyed by Reveluvs when they say that SM doesn't promote them I apologise if you aren't a reveluv and you feel annoyed hearing this, RV is genuinely mistreated by SM. Exo gets a lot of attention from their company and so does NCT, infact they experiment so much with NCT like making sub groups and stuff that it makes me feel like they are only interested in them and not in RV at all, there is almost zero content of RV despite having such amazing musicality. It is like the ignored sibling among the other groups, whatever success RV has got is soully because of their talent and nothing else. 8. Red Velvet isn’t going to last in the long run with SM The girls have been able to go along and still get recognition because of their constant potrayal of talent, Pyscho was genuinely the song where all members were able to shine, I really can’t imagine them lasting any longer than that, even if they would have to- they’d have to do something extremely unique/eye-catching to last more. I always get this gut-feeling that they are going to disband soon and do their own solo stuff. Now they could only last if they were promoted well from their initial days, because of lack of promotions they will probably won’t last.

Red Velvet is my ultimate girl bias group, so these are just some of my honest thoughts as a fan ever since about 2015. I’m not sure if these are unpopular opinions but here goes: Wendy has a long way to go to being being the top vocal of SM. I thought that Wendy was going to be that vocalist. I thought that she’d be the next voice of SM’s female artists. But the thing is, after Red Flavor and watching her live performances, it seems like her voice has gotten weaker. Some of her of belts aren’t sustained, and I’m actually not surprised, considering how she was the unhealthiest during that comeback. To me, the top female vocals of SM are sill Taeyeon and Luna. Maybe with more experience and time, Wendy can continue to improve and train, but as of right now, I still think Taeyeon and Luna are some of the best yet.Irene is the ultimate visual of the third generation girl groups. I know that beauty is in the eye of the beholder, but I just think that Irene’s visuals are well-praised because they’re conventional, fit the Korean standards of beauty, and hard to hate on. That makes her a well-received person based on her looks. She’s been given so many CF deals, praises on shows and in real life by fans for her face, and I personally agree. She’s my bias in the group and Baechu knows how to work it!Seulgi and Joy make up the stage presence of Red Velvet. I’ve seen mutiple fancams of each of the members throughout all of their comebacks, and Seulgi and Joy seem to stand out the most to me. Both of the have gorgeous figures that allow dance moves to look chic, smooth, powerful, and sexy if that’s even possible. Both of them seem to take the music and complement it with great facial expressions that hard carry the group. Though Wendy, Yeri, and Irene do have their moments, something about Seulgi and Joy just makes my eyes wander to them almost every time.Their voices get nasally in many songs. I don’t know if it’s a stylistic choice or if their voices have always been this way, but for me, Seulgi and Yeri’s voices have always sounded nasally. I personally am not a fan of nasally voices and prefer more light and warm vocal timbres. Even Wendy can get nasally at times, especially during their live performances, but I guess it can’t be helped.Wendy’s yo-yo dieting is dangerous and is affecting her vocal potential. When I saw her during Russian Roulette, my first impression was, “Woah. She lost a lot of weight. Is she okay?” And when she lost even more weight during the Red Flavor era, she was the skinniest that she ever was. When I saw her perform live, she would sound very weak in her belts, breathless, and she just looked so frail. I remember Ailee talking about eating 500 calories a day to lose weight, and when she did, her voice changed so much that she didn’t like how she sounded at all. So she gained more weight so that she could sustain her belts and so that her voice sounded healthier. Same with Luna from f(x). She explicitly stated that she gained some weight ever since her 4 Walls era so that her voice would be more powerful for her solo debut. Wendy’s the type to lose weight very easily, and each time she does, I feel like her voice becomes more and more fragile and less like how it was before.I prefer their Red concepts over the Velvet. I may be the only one to say that I like their pop and funky songs, but it’s true. To me, that’s the popular way to define Red Velvet as a group. They’re quirky, experimental, energetic, and confident. Sold. Even though I’m in love with their Velvet side songs, I can’t resist their iconic bops like Dumb Dumb, Rookie (I know, don’t clip me for liking that song :P), and Really Bad Boy. Oh yeah, and Peak-a-Boo and Bad Boy were the perfect marriage of Red + Velvet. Just sayin’. (UPDATE: THEIR NEW JAPANESE TRACK, “SAPPY”, IS GIVING ME MAJOR “DUMB DUMB” VIBES!)If they keep on having frequent comebacks, their popularity will not decline. Right now, Red Velvet and EXO are SM’s stable investments. They’re groups with songs that do relatively well each comeback, they maintain pretty frequent appearances in the industry (which I love from SM), and even if their “peak” was already reached, that doesn’t mean that their popularity will plummet. If anything, it will probably be stagnant, which isn’t necessarily a bad thing. You could interpret that as Red Velvet doing well each year ;)They do concepts like no one else in the K-pop industry. They’re one of those experimental groups that aren’t afraid to try anything and everything. Red Velvet has done, peppy, girly, girl-crush, summery, chic, ballads, funky, and so much more. But the difference between them and some other groups is that Red Velvet actually pulls off each of these concepts successfully. They’re able to fit every realm of ideas put out, and it looks natural on them. That’s pretty rare in the K-pop industry, so I’m glad they’ve been able to do well.Their b-side tracks in all of their albums are top-notch. Some companies put all their effort into their title tracks and have b-sides as loose filler to make up a mediocre album. But for me, Red Velvet’s b-sides are just as captivating as their title tracks. Every time they comeback with another album, I’m so tempted to buy it because every track is gold. But sadly, I’m broke, so no K-pop albums for me :(There is no “bad” Red Velvet song. That’s right, I think that none of the Red Velvet songs are bad. They’re quirky, catchy, skillfully crafted, and have unique instrumentals that keep me on my toes 24/7. I’ll admit, there have been some songs where I wasn’t sure if I was vibing with it, but after a few listens, I always fall in love.Irene has the visuals and dancing abilities, but not necessarily the stage presence. Irene is kind of like a doll. Sometimes, she can be lively, but in many of her fancams, especially when a song has been out for a while, she can be out of it.  These are just a few of my thoughts on my favorite girl group. I don’t want this to come off as hate, but just a few things that I’ve noted to myself within the past couple of years. Here’s to 2019 and hopefully another great year with Red Velvet and ReVeluvs!

There are good answers to this already so I guess I should be thankful I was requested? I don’t have too many, since they’re probably my favorite third gen girl group, but here are the few I have. Ya’ll hating on Yeri too much. There are senior artists who have complimented her for her voice and her self-written/composed songs, and told her that she was underestimating herself. I know that she doesn’t have the best stage presence, but she’s improved, especially this year. I wish people would give her a chance.Irene may not be much more than the visual at first glance, but she’s an integral part of Red Velvet. Do you really think the group would have been the same without her?Because of her “godlike” visuals, she has been able to promote Red Velvet all over Korea with commercials and ads. She’s the mother of the group, who always takes care of all the members, and her members in turn love her very much. She’s such a caring person and I feel like there’s hate against her for no reason other than “she’s pretty,” when in fact she’s also the lead dancer, center, leader, advertising head, and loving mother of the group.Their versatility is amazing, but they haven’t done every single concept to ever exist in the K-Pop world. (I’m not saying that they have to in order to be a good group, I’m just saying that people claim they have even though they haven’t.) In their title tracks, they’ve done mature sexy (Bad Boy), cute, playfully sexy (Peek-A-Boo), and badass, but they’ve never done girl crush or what I call the “fresh youth” type (GFriend type songs). This is probably because none of the members have the “hard voice” needed for a girl crush song. Wendy and Seulgi are amazing vocalists, and Joy has also improved a lot. But that doesn’t mean their voices are as fluid as their concepts. For example, someone I would say has a “hard voice” is Soyeon from G-Idle, or Jennie from BLACKPINK. They have the type of voice that can handle those girl crush songs, but Seulgi has a very flowing, kind of nasally voice and Joy and Yeri have very high pitched or light, airy vocals that wouldn’t suit the song.I will say though, they are so far the most versatile girl group I’ve seen. Their ballads are also incredible and always a treat to listen to.Wendy is not the best vocalist. There are people I’ve seen comparing her to Chen (EXO) as his female version, but no. She still has to improve more on her vocals until she reaches that level of stability and technique. I do love her voice, however, and I hope that she gets to showcase it more.Seulgi is not the best dancer of the third gen ggs. I actually can’t choose a “best dancer” due to my lack of experience in the field, so I hope no fanwars erupt in the comments while speculating. Her dance moves are effortless and fluid, but they aren’t as powerful or hard as, say - Hyoyeon. I know it comes from her experience in the industry as a senior artist and all that, but their styles are very different so it’s not quite a good comparison. I guess what I’m trying to say is that her dancing can’t portray everything.There is not a single “bad” Red Velvet song. Surprised? Yeah, I even liked Rookie, Power Up, and Really Bad Boy. Their versatility has allowed them to take on concepts or song styles never done before in the K-Pop industry and I have a lot of respect for them.The “Irene hates men” trope has become a way to attack her, but it’s really just an inside joke from the Reveluv fandom and I can’t help but sigh in disbelief and disappointment when people take it seriously.She doesn’t glare at every male specimen that looks her way, unlike what some antis seem to have gathered. Watch the Super TV episode with SuJu and Red Velvet. Watch her interactions with EXO, TVXQ, and NCT. This might also have to do with the fact that the groups are from her company, which inevidently means that she’d be closer to them than groups from other agencies. Some people just aren’t comfortable with strangers and it takes a while for them to open up. It’s well known that Irene is introverted.They get hate for literally no reason.Those are all my “official” unpopular opinions, though I’m not sure if all of them are actually unpopular. On a lighter note - I didn’t like Bad Boy as much as most of the K-Pop fandom did. I did like it, but I prefer Red Flavor and Peek-A-Boo. I think it’s because I found it too repetitive for my tastes, but this is just my personal opinion so just ignore it. Red Velvet is an amazing group. They’re all so funny and talented in their own ways. My bias is Seulgi, comment yours down below :)

So I am not a stan but I have few hope it’s enough since it was requested ;) 1.Seulgi is the star of the band-not only that she is one of the best female dancers today but her presence man, it's fierce I remember watching her with Taeyeong and even though MR. TY is one of my ults I could not take my eyes off her she is a star.  2. You don't appreciate Yeri not even near enough as you should-she writes songs for other artist and she is so talented, people step on her all the time she does not deserve that she is doing an amazing job and she is so young.  3. Irene doesn't hate men- what's wrong with ya'll did you see how she looks at Jackson Wang? No I am kidding but for real though she is a type that is not open with guys or maybe a type that holds to herself that does not mean that she hates men in any way I am not stan or there from beginning but as much as I know she was very shy at the being even having insecurities about her Daegu accent so give her a break with that.  4. Wendy is not the best vocalist of this generation-I heard that some people call her female Chen like sis no we are not gonna do that. I'll admit she is very talented but compare her to vocals like EXID's Solji or even someone new like Loona's Haseul she is not stunning. In current popular gg settings, she is the best she is better than BP's Rose and Twice's Jihyo for sure. Also, I think that she is problematic but not as problematic as people love to present her biggest fault IMO is the fact that she did not apologize for her mistakes, but it's not all on her Korea is not really awake in every possible way.  5. They don't need to rap-they are not good. Why does SM force rap on them when it's not in their nature? 6. Bad Boy is their best title track-say what you want but that song is art. Most of RV songs are pop hits this one stands out; it's very unique and different.  7. I don't see Irene's role in band-visual and leader OK but were on earth is her talent? Like in music? She is not the best dancer, she is not a vocalist either and her official title "main rapper" is kind of ridiculous. Her visual game is strong but her stage presence is not IMO.  8. Joy is most lovable one-it's just so easy to love her and her charisma is out of this world.

Yeri was never mean to be part of Red Velvet. Being young wasn’t the reason for her to not debut. Lots of SM artists debut under the age of 18. Moreover, Automatic was recorded at when Joy is around 15 y/o (Seulgi and Irene danced to it when they were still in SMROOKIES). If Yeri was supposed to be in Red Velvet in the first place, she would have also recorded with them. They also sometimes overlapped Yeri's part when they aren’t supposed to, because those meant to be their lines at first. And then we have SM who aren’t dumb. They have had so much dramas that year to bring more hate to their new group. It's obvious adding a new member will get hates, and why would SM do that? Obviously not because they can't wait for their new girl group member to turn 18. You can defense she is in Happiness MV, but so is other SMROOKIES members, it wasn't meant to prove anything. And a blank spot on Wendy's part Shine on me was simply how the choreography works with 4 members. The number will always turn odd. Joy also revealed she was stressed when Yeri joined because she was supposed to be cute, but now it's Yeri's job and she has to think of something else to pull out. Think about it, if Joy known about Yeri joining she would have had something in mind before.Seulgi and Wendy suits every single Red Velvet concepts. Yeri has this very cute look for her to be girl crush style but then Irene has this mature look to act forcely acting cute. Joy used to be in cute, but imo it didn't even fit her well, which explains why she can't go back to it once she had already switched to sexy. That's why she fits Velvet side way more.Yeri saves Red Velvet. Yes she isn't the most talented member, and SM only started promoting Red Velvet after her joining, but she and Wendy is literally the reason why i watch game shows with Red Velvet. They both make everything so funny and entertaining to watch. Try Knowing Bros with Red Velvet, Yeri brought the vibe, that's why I believe she was a great add to the group and she deserved to be treated so.Wendy is underrated. Everyone knows how amazing she is at singing, but what about others? She was the worst dancer in the group back in 2014, but the 3rd best dancer after RBB era. She improved, a lot. She also have potential of being at least lead rapper, but being the main vocalist doesn't allow her to. Search up Red Velvet Wendy rapping, that girl is literally amazing but people just don't know.Irene is a great leader despise her not talking a lot. She doesn't bring the vibe to everyone, but she always is the most caring one. I have watched too many Red Velvet game shows to name when Irene secretly share the loser’s treat. She always is the one carrying the most when they are on the trip, and she tries not to cry in front of everyone. She is trying her best and deserve the love.Joy is not okay. This is extremely unpopular, but I feel like I'm the only one who feels that. I know she always look so positive, that's why her stage name was Joy since the first place. However, remember how she collapse in Happiness perfomance? It was confirmed it wasn't electric shock, she just is scared of those fireworks and those are big fears that reached to a point of her collapsing. She looks like she was going to cry yet she continued perfoming. I feel like she had faced something really bad to reach her to that point of scaring. Moreover, she looks very tired in a lot of perfomance. Just take a look at Umpah Umpah or Zimzalabim, or even Psycho, and compare that to enthusiastic Red Flavor Joy. She looks like she is out of breathe sometimes and I feel worried about her. I feel like it was from the Media School she was in (which said that had been doing bad stuff to the students and was exposed around 1-2 years ago), but it’s just my thought. Netherless Joy isnt ok is a fact and we should start caring about it.Red Velvet MVs are underrated. Just because they don't look fancy like Blackpink doesn't make them bad. They contains lots deep meanings and I enjoy watching them the most in the whole Kpop.Their choreography are god-tier. Other than Yeri never been able to center, other members all had their epic moment and are able to shine. I dont know why people think those are bad, they are just very complicated but awesome, they stand and sit on stage in a lot of perfomance. They switch spots very often and their moves arent repetitive (which is why in Weekly Idol at Random Play Dance they kept not knowing their spot since they werent sure which verse is it). I love the Dumb Dumb dance, the ideas and everything.Although Yeri is not untalented, she never shined and we have to admit it. The only song she ever shines to me is the rap in Peekaboo, and that's it. She never stands out in almost every songs, and her vocal nor rap nor dance is the strongest in the group. She was more of the vibe add that SM decided to do on Red Velvet, not the talent add. In some way i sort of feel bad for her, she would have shined in other groups.Red Velvet has very few stage prescense. Not no, but very few. Again i would have to nominate Son Seungwan and Kang Seulgi for this position, as those 2 are the only ones with good stage prescense. Joy doesn't, and as I mentioned I think that kind of relate to her health issue as her prescense was very good before. Irene, it is her personality, but as an idol i do think she should change, altho she never did and probs never will. Yeri i dont know how to say it, but i partly feel like its her lack of confidence. She mentioned she isnt a very smiling-person. She is often described as having a mad face before debuting, which is why i think she isnt very comfortable smiling all time during perfomances. But i kind of think she should. One of the rare time when her stage prescense is good, check out Talk To Me stage.

I truly believe Yeri was never supoosed to be part of RV. If you watch their predebut dance of “Automatic”, the dance was very obviously made for four. The audio wasn’t actually the official “Automatic” song and OP just edited it in. You can tell cause the dance isn’t always in sync and you can sometimes see Irene or Joy singing Yeri’s part. When that video first came out, I wondered what SM’s true plans were for RV since I really believe they would’ve had a more mature sound and probably would’ve stuck to the red vs. velvet sound. I also wondered if Yeri would’ve been a part if SM’s NGG, and how maybe waiting would’ve brought her so much less pain and hate.HOWEVER….I think Yeri was a great and important addition to the group. Her voice is very unique, and I never truly respected it until I heard her in the ReVe Festival Day 2 album. Her vocals are INSANE and give their songs so much richness, especially for their Velvet songs. It reminds me of honey since it’s very smooth, and it contrasts well with Joy’s fresh vibrant vocals. Now that doesn’t mean she has the best technique since I think she can still work on that, but I can’t imagine RV’s songs without her. Also, her presence in variety makes a difference. All the members’ personalities bounce off each other so well, and Yeri’s youthful, carefree energy gives the older members a lot to work with.Speaking of vocals, I think SM should stop giving Yeri and Irene mediocre raps since they have GREAT vocals already. Their Red raps are cute at best and cringy at worst. On the other hand, their Velvet raps are where it’s at tbh. Usually these raps ate always good and not out of place, whereas their Red raps sometimes feel just thrown in. But again, I’ve noticed in their ReVe Festival Day 2 album that both of their voices work great in the choruses. The girls harmonize very well, and I think Irene and Yeri’s pulls it all together. Even when they aren’t just singing the chorus, they slay their individual lines and should be given more to work with.Seulgi is a great dancer and vocalist, and she has unbeatable stage presence. She’s their goddamn ace for sure, but I really don’t find myself impressed with her dancing a lot of the time. What I mean is, her group dancing is always great, but when given other choreo or when doing freestyle, I just don’t find myself impressed with it. Maybe it’s the choreography or something, but I find myself preferring other idol dancers.I have a few thoughts on Wendy.Her actions when she imitated black and white people were not racist, but they were ignorant and she was definitely stereotyping. She deserves criticism, and it’s fine if you decide to not supoort her, but you will gain absolutely nothing by attacking her with racist and other harmful remarks.I honestly have no idea what she did to her face, like I keep looking at her debut stages/pictures and her current stages/pictures but I cannot for the life of me figure out how she’s changed. I suspected a nose job, but in Bad Boy teasers her nose looks almost the same as her debut nose. I know this isn’t even an opinion, but jesus it’s honestly irritating me so much that I can’t pinpoint what she changed. People say jaw surgery, but her jaw looks the same! Search her “Be Natural” fancam and compare with her current fancams; they’re the goddamn same. Maybe fillers? Or botox? I thought it was her hair, then her weight, but in the “Butterfly” stages from one of the Gayo Daejuns, she has no bangs and is about the same weight yet STILL looks different. Like is it really just age and stress from the idol life (crazy diets, no sleep, general stress and fatigue, etc)?? The other girls almost look entirely the same (except maybe Joy but I just accepted it has something to do with her teeth/lips). This is stupid and long, but I hate not knowing lol.RV’s biggest enemy is SM. They could be bigger in the West if SM promoted them as much as they do NCT 127 (a casual fan of 127, but I got recommended SO many of their America interviews). RV’s Velvet sound is their STRONGEST point, and SM should showcase those sidetracks more! “So Good”, “Kingdom Come”, “Light Me Up”, “Sunny Side Up”, “Eyes Locked, Hands Locked”. Their rnb sound is PURE BLISS. But barely anyone outside of the reveluv fandom knows this. They should be singing these on radio shows and just performing them more!! Put it on their goddamn setlist for their concerts god dammit. There’s 2 main things I’d complain about to SM and it’d be their promotion for NCT, and then their promotion for RV. STEP UP YOUR GAME SM!! We want VELVET TRACKS!

Warning: may be offensive Joy deserves to be visual Irene just has a plain face, sure it fits korea's standards but she doesn't show any expressions and it can be a bit average if she doesn't put effort. Joy on the other hand looks ethereal without even trying.  Seulgi, Joy and Wendy have the best stage presence. No, let me correct myself, Seulgi, Joy and Wendy only have the stage presence. Yeri occasionally zones out and Irene has the same blank expression during performances. Wendy literally GLOWS during stages like Power Up and Red Flavour. Joy and Seulgi OWNED Bad Boy and Peek a Boo. The rumor of Irene bullying other trainees to leave is much more beleivable that Joy scaring trainees. The rumors are first of all absolutely groundless, ridiculous and stupid. Netizens, if you are gonna make rumors at LEAST try and make them realistic. Irene would be most likely to scare trainees away because she has a very quiet, scary demeanor. Joy on the other hand doesn't. Irene just keeping silent would be enough to get anyone on edge. NOT Joy. Yeri’s relationship with NCT Dream is adorable. She's the maknae of RV but still a noona to the dreamies. She has the best relationdhip with them and treats them like younger brothers. Most people hate their closeness because of the ships. But Yeri doesnt make the atmosphere ‘flirty’ or anything but plain friendly. Which is why, along with Heechul and Taehyung, she is the most sociable idols. (The reason this^ is an unpopular opinion is because most ppl hate her and nct but i adore them)  Irene hating men isnt ‘funny' Sure, the posts of her avoiding men on youtube and twitter are something to laugh at but the faces she makes when man just PASS BY her are stupid. They didn't even LOOK at her but she seems angry. People say it's funny but i dont think it is (thus it's an unpopular opinion).  But in cases like these she is totally right:  Joy's acting isn't that bad It's actually pretty good for a rookie actor and still active idol. She did better than most idols when they debuted in the acting industry. And her kiss scene……not too awkward and not too much. Not perfect but better than how other idols would do it. Plus the role she was playing was hard to portray.  Them being hated on for eating bingsu or ice cream (i dunno which) after their win for power up was IDIOTIC. Twice ate ice. Red Velvet ate too…..just a food with better taste and more calories. Nobody hated on Twice so why hate on RV?  Wendy's weight loss was tragic For others, it would be goals to lose that mich weight in such little time. But in reality, her weight ballooned majorly when she was onstage, offstage, on promotions and on rest. Her constant weight gain and weight loss in little time shows the struggles she had with food. When she gains it was a result of falling in love with food or binge eating. When she loses weight it was her restricting herself too much or simply depriving herself of food and joy after gaining. To us it's goals but to her it's a mental battle. Whether she loves food or hates it. And i really hopes she finds the in between.  Joy's weight loss was the best Along with Jihyo's , Joy has the steadiest and prettiest weight loss. Tbh she looked great before as well. It's unpopular because ppl prefer quick weight losses but i don't? I prefer healthy, happy idols not broken, deprived ones.   Joy and Seulgi fit every Red Velvet concept. Be it Red or Velvet, Seulgi and Joy can pull it off.

I’m not a ReVeluv, but I do listen to Red Velvet’s music quite often. Please don’t hate on me if you don’t agree with me. SM likes Seulgi the mostI say this because in many music videos, Seulgi gets the most screen time. She often stands out with her outfits, etc. She is also positioned in the middle a lot. It also looks like a lot more effort was put into her makeup and looks. It also seems like sometimes she overshadows the other members, for example in Umpah Umpah the other girls didn’t have very bright colours for their dresses but Seulgi really stood out in bold pink. 2. Their newer music videos are better I think songs like Umpah Umpah and Zimzalabim are better than the older songs, in terms of aesthetic and looks. Some of the other songs had a very basic concept for aesthetic and the same dance moves over and over again. 3. Irene should not be main rapper Irene is talented in general, but she does not fit the ‘rapper’ vibe. She would do way better as a vocalist. 4. They should not do rap All 5 girls are talented, but sometimes it seems they lack in the rap talent. I can see them all as successful vocalists. Their rap just isn’t as strong as the vocal line. 5. Sappy and Russian Roulette were their best songs They aren’t the most popular songs, but in my opinion they are very underrated. For example Umpah Umpah had a summer vacation vibe to it, and Peekaboo had a dark, mysterious cheeky vibe. Red Velvet doesn’t really focus on being cute, they focus on being unique.

I love Red Velvet! Here are my unpopular opinions about them, not to cause any offense to anyone, but as requested I will answer: Yeri doesn’t deserve the hate she is getting. Especially with her stage presence, honestly from the moment there were speculations that she was performing poorly on stage, I would say she has definitely improved throughout their comebacks. And she has noticed that lots of people have been saying that about her, and she is trying to make an effort the best she can possibly do. So please stop with the hate comments on Yeri, you can dislike her but throwing all this hate on her, won’t help her at all.Seulgi and Joy are probably the faces of the group. Really whenever I think of red velvet, those names and faces pop up in my head the most. I know Irene is probably the face of the group, and the center as what her profiles are saying, but she doesn’t really stand out as much compared to these two. Everyone is beautiful in Red Velvet, there is no true visual in Red Velvet but these two probably stand out in terms of stage presence.‘Really Bad Boy’. Was probably the most disappointing comeback for Red Velvet, they didn’t even win any music show awards despite who was competing with them. The song was good, vocals and visuals were on point as always, but the lyrics were very repetitive and quite corny (In my opinion). Not to mention, it always seems to be compared with their better song ‘Bad Boy’, which was well sought out.I honestly can’t get into ‘Rookie’. I love most of Red Velvet’s songs, but Rookie is one that I just cannot get into no matter how many times I listen to it.‘Kingdom Come’ needed a live. Oh my god, if Red Velvet ever needed to perform one of their side tracks, this song better be in a performance. This song is an absolute bop, and needed that stage performance it deserves.Red Velvet does an amazing job with their concept. I don’t know if this is even a unpopular opinion. But they have explained before that “Red” is in terms of happiness and songs that are upbeat and joyful. While “Velvet” is more mature and serious, probably a ballad or something like ‘Peek-a-boo”, ‘Bad Boy’. or ‘Automatic’. They do a really good job of evenly dividing that concept. In almost most of their comebacks you get one or the other.Red Velvet won’t be the nation’s girl group of their generation. They are really popular, and have a large fanbase. But compared to when SNSD was really active, they do not have the same response. Twice holds that same response as SNSD, which I would consider Twice the nation’s girl group.Wendy is not one of SM’s greatest vocalists. Despite her song with John Legend, and a few individual activities. She still has a long way to go, her vocals are quite average, but I don’t think what she has shown us as of now is her true potential and her best voice.That is probably all of the unpopular opinions I have about Red Velvet, unless I think of anything else to add, I will comeback and edit it. Again, not here to offend any fan, but just to state my opinion.

I’ve discovered this magnificent group back in January, but I’ll still try to put out my thoughts, too: Irene’s role in the group is still unclear.I’m not saying she has no talent or anything like that, but clearly their label is playing dirty games when it comes to her. She’s known as the “visual” of the group, but…Quite frankly, I find this title rather embarrassing and tacky. And the saddest part is that a big part of the fandom finds it sensible. THIS AIN’T IT!Yeri is criminally underrated.Do I need to say more? Yes, she is underrated from the begging and it’s pretty noticible. That’s so unfortune because this girl shows so much potential! Her voice is very unique, fits every theme, she’s a very cheerful and energetic performer with charisma. She should be put as a lead on at least a B-Cut song! She’s basically on a race with Irene when it comes to getting least lines. So unfair and their label doesn’t give a…about it.Rookie is a very good song.I honestly was shook when I first found out that it was less approved by the fandom and even sometimes listed as “worst RR song”! Girl…I’m still gonna continue to listen to it EVERY DAY and keep it on REPLAY. PerdiodT.Their rap game isn’t terrible, nor is it perfect! Well it’s not considered bad, because they’re simply aren’t known for that. And I’m only saying this because they don’t do that anymore or do it very rearly. But they showed so much potential with it! For example, I only listen to Red Flavor because those rap verses delivered from Irene and Yeri are honestly brilliant. It makes the song so much better and enjoyable!Wendy = Seulgi, when it comes to vocal strenght.Yes, you have read it here first! These ones are known to be titled as “best singers of the group”. And not for nothing! No denying that Wendy is a power-house vocalist and it really shows. But when talking about the tone…Seulgi takes the cake, even though it’s close. Her voice is also very alluring and somewhat strong as well. It’s a close battle but I think they’re equally strong in this field.Hear the Sea is Top 10 in their discography.Oh heck yeah! I love this song, even though Irene and Yeri are both kinda robbed in it… But this track is honestly magic. 10/10.I could listen to it all day long and it puts me in such a calming and neat mood. Also I think it’s their best ballad.Peek-A-Boo era had the best looks.I know many can agree but their looks that era were FIRE. Not too over-the-top, not too basic. They were perfect. Joy, Yeri and Irene were the highlights of course.Their Japanese tracks are top-notch, underappreciated. Not that it’s that upopular of a fact, but clearly it isn’t emphasized enough!My favorites:Sayonara - very fair line distribution (Hear the Sea can’t relate), heavinly melody and VOCALS.#Cookie Jar - a fun, positively quirky, happy song. Easily tops some of their overhyped Korean stuff. Sappy - trully a highlight on its own. Very cohesive and fun. Deserved to top the Japanese charts. …There should be no “leaders” in this group.Irene’s role as “leader of the group” isn’t that deserved, nor needed. Wendy could be considered as one but she doesn’t have to. There’s simply no reason why there needs to be one, especially in this group.Actually, most of the girls groups out there don’t even have that position.They all deserve at least a 3-month break from everything. I feel like they’re overdoing it a bit, to the point that it can become unhealthy. A longer break from EVERYTHING would do wonders to them. These girls work their asses off, but I think a little cooldown is essential.There are no “worst singers” in the group.Yep, all girls have their strenghts when it comes to singing. Wendy, Seulgi and Joy are known for their brilliant heights and prominence. Irene and Yeri are known for their charming, heavenly, soft and melodic tones. There are no bad singers in this group.Sunny Side Up! > Zimzalabim.I’m not a Zimbzalabim hater, I also don’t think it shouldn’t have been the lead single. I simply think that Sunny Side Up! is the best track on their latest record and it honestly has such a cool, rare vibe. I can’t never get enough of this song!They are equally beautiful, in and out.They all are talented. They all make Red Velvet. They all are shining on their own.Irene is not useless, she just often feels out of place.Her role in the group is poorly handled but that doesn’t mean she’s worthless. She’s the most mature of them. It feels like she’s in line with everyone and takes care of everyone. She just cannot be not needed. Without her there would be no Red Velvet, just like without any other member.They don’t have bad songs, but I feel like low-key Dumb Dumb is not that good.I could say it’s their worst song but I’d wrong, because I listen to it. If it was bad I wouldn’t bother listening. It’s just too repetitive I guess.

I’ve just recently been getting more into Red Velvet, and while I don’t know them enough to have their names memorized off the top of my head, but I do know them, I do have just one or two slightly unpopular opinions that might send a few ReVeluvs after me. Oh well. Onto the question! Unpopular Opinion 1 Why is their music so babylike? Nothing against them, I mean, I love their songs and all, but these are grown women singing about Ice Cream Cake, and how “It’s so tasty! Come and chase me!” Yeah, and then the companies wonder why their idols get things like death threats and sasaeng fans stalking their every single move. It just seems like by now, they would have more mature sounding music. It’s cute and I get that fans would love that, but for me, it’s just kinda.. off.. Unpopular Opinion 2 For me, this kinda extends for almost all K-Pop girl (and boy) groups, but they are so skinny. Once again, I understand that image is massive in South Korea, but to require your trainees to be painfully thin and even get plastic surgery?? Eesh… I just wonder how badly that might toll on their health. Now that I think about it, this opinion might be very popular, actually. Unpopular Opinion 3 Last one for now, but as many ReVeluvs would know, they came out with “The Perfect Velvet” in November of 2017, and then came out with the repackage, aptly named “The Perfect Red Velvet” on January 29 2018. Okay, just an album, right? Yes. But, you might notice that they are similarly titled and has a new song. Once again, normal for a repackage, right? Yeah. But that title. It’s like the company was saying that they weren’t perfect before, and now they are. Or even just the fact that the girls are perfect in general! I mean, don’t get me wrong, Irene, Seulgi, Yeri, Joy and Wendy are all amazing and I can’t wait to get more into this group, but still. That title.. “The Perfect Red Velvet..” Eesh, say that in a creepy voice. No thanks. That’s all for now! I might come back and add more depending on whether I get more into the group or not, but anyways, that’s all for now!

K-pop stans need to realize that Red Velvet will not always be who they want to be. Yes, it is normal for people to set expectations in a group’s comeback but in Red Velvet’s case, especially after a Velvet comeback (which some people like more enough for it to go crazy popular), people who don’t really know them or people who became a fan only because they want more songs like Bad Boy only mainly listen to songs with heavy bass drops or girl-crush/cutesy songs because they’re easy to bop to.Red Velvet are not just “Summer Queens”. With the huge, influential success of Red Flavor and Power Up in Korea, I think that RV keeps on coming back during summer season just because they are perceived as the “Summer Queens” and they are the most demanded group in Korea during the season, which does a lot to their digital and album sales. However, I also believe that Red Velvet, however unpopular they may be compared to today’s mainstream K-pop groups, will eventually stop their summer comeback thing after some time. I’m sure they wouldn’t want to only be remembered for their summer songs because that is not the reason why their group was formed in the first place. It’s not their brand at all. So, I don’t blame them if they choose not to return with another summer comeback in the coming years.Out of the 3rd Gen girl groups, Red Velvet (and Mamamoo) will be the last to disband or in the very least, have a member leave the group. Now hol’ up, hear me out, I know that the majority thinks that Irene will leave the group the soonest because she is in the finishing line of her 20’s so she might want to start pursuing solo careers or even quit being an idol stuff like that, BUT I think that because of 2nd gen groups staying together even inactive ones (look at Girls’ Generation!), the next generations will surely follow in their steps and make sure their group lasts until they get tired of it. Now, as to why I think Red Velvet will last the longest among the Big 3 ggs: their experimental music is the #1 factor why the public will still love them after so long. PLUS, they are not mainly performance-based rather they rely more on their singing and instrumental voices which is another huge factor because idols can’t keep on dancing those hard, quick, symmetrical, trendy choreography when they get older. Their diverse title tracks and B-sides are not limited and targeted to a certain age group, so even if RV are in their 30’s, I guarantee you they would still perform songs like Happiness or Zimzalabim even.

One good thing about them is that they can carry nearly all kinds of concepts - the energetic Happiness, the creepy Russian Roulette, serial killers in Peek-a-Boo, etc. Not many girl groups can do/are doing this, even SNSD - well, yeah, they have a few girl crush songs but it feels kind of weird. But RV, on the other hand, really handles them fairly well. Their vocals are pretty stable - better than Blackpink, I would say. But their voices…Not really sure about that. I love Irene’s, Seulgi’s and Wendy’s voices, they are beautiful, and I am also okay with Yeri’s, but Joy’s is a little odd compared with the other 4, and sometimes her voice is not clear enough (idk if it’s nasal or not). Their dances are definitely overhyped though. To be honest, Seulgi is the only one who has better dancing, but her freestyle is really weird. Besides, many people are saying that they have knife choreography, but I don’t think so. They are not really in sync, and some of their dances are too easy and weak (weak as in the moves, not their skills) to be classified as knife choreography. Lastly, I really find Joy’s and Yeri’s personalities annoying. Joy is obviously thinking too high of herself sometimes, and Yeri really went too far when she said RV is the Nation’s Girl Group - like, no. SNSD is still here (although they are somehow breaking apart), and RV isn’t particularly more liked than Twice and Blackpink, who are also hot girl groups atm.

•They have the best concept out of the big 3 girl groups• The whole “Red” and “velvet” concept is actually really intriguing and I’d like to see more concepts like it in the future. And Irene’s so called “bland personality” really fits it in my opinion. •They’re not good rappers• I don’t think this is too unpopular but it’s definitely true. However, that’s not a bad thing. SM specializes in vocals and Red Velvet’s concept fits vocals better than rap to me. •They have good stage presence• I will say that I their earlier days their stage presence wasn’t the best but they’ve definitely improved. Joy seems to have improved the most and I’d even say her presence is equal to or even better than Seulgi’s as of now. •Wendy isn’t the best vocalist of this generation• In the big 3, then I’d say she is. But you can’t discard all the other amazing vocalists outside of the big 3. There’s artists like IU, all of Mamamoo, Taeyeon, Ailee, and Luna that, at least in my opinion, are better than Wendy. She’s in no way a bad vocalist, though.  •Irene is important to the group• To me she’s an amazing leader. She’s definitely very mature which is what I believe makes her the good leader she is. But In the talent area, then I would say she doesn’t add too much. •Joy is my favorite visual• With Seulgi not far behind.

Favorite songs Peek-A-Boo Bad Boy RBB Zimzalabim Psycho Members Irene : Incredibly beautiful. Can be funny when she wants to, and has a personality that comes off as shy or maybe even cold at first glance but in fact can be very warm, especially as the leader of the group. Seulgi : Awesome dancer. One of the most attractive members in my opinion, suits RV’s “Red” concept as well as their “Velvet” concept but Seulgi with bangs will forever be superior. The main dancer who has a beautiful voice(SBS Gayo Daejeon 2018, Dreams Come True special stage). Wendy : My first favorite during RBB era, blonde suits her very well. Another extremely talented member with her the ability to hit insanely high notes. Again, she looks best in blonde. Joy : From what I've seen, a very entertaining member. Her smile is one of the cutest and she acts just like her name-Joy. Has many fangirls as well as fanboys and is also a good singer. Yeri : I like her rap. Especially in Peek-A-Boo, her part was the one that I enjoyed the most. Could be the visual if it wasn't for Irene, that's how pretty I think she is. Music Personally, I like their unique concepts that no other group tries. Of course, Ice Cream Cake can be a little… well, scary to be honest, but that’s what makes their music entertaining to listen to. Also, songs like Dumb Dumb are very catchy and you can get easily addicted to them. Choreo Sometimes not my type, but that applies to every kpop group out there. RBB had one of the best choreos and their more mature “Velvet” sides, such as Bad Boy and Psycho, brings out the best of them. Style Sometimes I can't help but wonder what their stylists are thinking, I mean, what happened to Zimzalabim Wendy, but then again, unique is what Red Velvet is all about. Their outfits can be very stylish, too, which I like. Okay, hope you enjoyed reading. Bye :)

I think this can be irrelevant answer to the question but also can add value to the person of asking so I will comment on the basis of what I read today somewhere online (probably a Korean one) discussing how less popular k-pop idols use their sexuality as the last resort to rise to the top of the hierarchy. Within that forum, the argument went both ways, one saying that k-pop idols are essentially trading their soul for instant fame whereas the counter saying that it’s evident everywhere in capitalism in which farmers are resorting to GMO crops and inevitably trading their ethics for quick profit. Although I see both arguments being valid, I indeed felt bad for k-pop idols even compared to main stream artists. Artists have sensitive souls and when circumstances are not parallel to their flow, they have to resort to drastic measures. I just hope that the whole industry and the world acknowledges this and come together in protecting our artists. They are the leaders for our culture development and often are neglected after the transactions are made, which in turn produces in fallen stars. I’ve heard of Irene and Red Velvet previously, but I doubt if they are ripping the scene. I presume that they’d be nearly at the end of growth period of their commodity cycle as a k-pop group. They might not think that they have hit their potential yet, but I sincerely hope that they realize life is not all about becoming the #1 best selling idol in Korea.

Kind, funny, and talented, how could you not love a girl group like Red Velvet?

I actually don’t like it. Chocolate shouldn’t be red in my opinion. But it is a classic Southern cake and it is often requested for family birthdays and holidays so I make it. I do use a homemade cream cheese icing, it has a lighter flavor than anything store bought and doesn’t over power the cake. Done right, red velvet can be great, done wrong it’s horrible. No matter what flavor cake you are making, it should be moist and light, not wet and dense. It should have an icing/frosting/glaze that compliments the cake, not overpowers it. You should want a second piece, not sit there holding your plate waiting for a chance to sneak it in the trash.

My mother baked me a Red Velvet cake every year for my birthday. She made the correct icing which is NOT the cream cheese frosting you get at the grocery store. Real frosting for Red Velvet is cooked and has a subtle flavor that does not overpower the cake like the cream cheese frosting does. Red Velvet has a lovely chocolate flavor and is moist and delicious, if you follow the correct recipe.
